programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.sub-title: Dr Amanda removes a sable antelopes collar, and the team helps a baby vervet monkey find a new mum; two orphaned serval cats are also freed, and we follow 20 yellow baboons into their new enclosure.
programme.desc: The team at the Lilongwe Wildlife Trust in Malawi in Africa are dedicated to rescuing and rehabilitating injured and orphaned animals, ensuring they get back into the wild where they belong.

programme.title: Outback Vet
programme.sub-title: Cyclone Damien, the biggest cyclone to hit Karratha for ten years, heads towards the Vet Hospital; meanwhile, a lady prepares to cross Australia by camel in the Pilbara desert.
programme.desc: Meet Rick Fenny, a 40-year career veterinarian; he regularly embarks on a round trip across Western Australia to visit remote clients, working with animals in some of the most hostile conditions.

programme.title: Wild LatAm
programme.sub-title: The desert of Chile is the driest in the world, but its marine currents are thought to be the richest on the planet; we come across Andean flamingos, burrowing owls, and the Fabians lizard.
programme.desc: A vibrant portrait of the biodiverse habitats in South America; inhabitants range from large to small, from colourful to perfectly camouflaged, and from the lone hunter to thousand-strong hordes.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Julian races to an emergency at a local farm where a cow is unable to stand up, and Peter tries to save three-week-old Sphynx kitten Dobby; his tiny patient has pneumonia.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: This episode marks International Dog Day; Julian has performed lots of surgery on his clients four-legged friends, but its a bit different when the patient is his own faithful companion Emmy.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Join Julz on a ZCP lion-collaring mission, go fishing with scout Simon, study mealtime pack hierarchy and witness a heartbreaking vigil for a badly-injured Kakumbi pup.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Head back to the den with the Kakumbi - who are mourning the loss of two pups - and chance upon a hyena lair and a lion pride trying to take down a buffalo.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.sub-title: Dr Amanda removes a sable antelopes collar, and the team helps a baby vervet monkey find a new mum; two orphaned serval cats are also freed, and we follow 20 yellow baboons into their new enclosure.
programme.desc: The team at the Lilongwe Wildlife Trust in Malawi in Africa are dedicated to rescuing and rehabilitating injured and orphaned animals, ensuring they get back into the wild where they belong.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: Its 100 degrees and rising; as waterholes dry up, Julz is alarmed to find lions in the Kakuli packs favourite drinking spot but also gets to touch a wild dog for the first time ever.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: Theres a shock in the borderlands where the Stork Colony pack roams, Vultures, elephants, baboons, and hyenas make for noisy neighbours for the Manzi pack, and the Kakuli pack goes missing.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Peters under extra pressure with Charlie the horse - he belongs to his niece Jess; when Julian sees Jackie Barlow, its usually about one of her alpacas, but today the patient is her little dog Isla.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Julian is called to an emergency on Tom Stockils farm and Peter removes an ominous looking lump for boxer dog Boot; this brings back bittersweet memories for Peter of his own beloved boxer Alf.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: An emotional emergency for Peter at a friends farm; Steves wife is seriously ill, and now her favourite sheeps life is in the balance. Julian tries to remove an abscess on Karine the alpacas chin.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: Pride of India
programme.desc: Gujarat in India is home to the last Asiatic lions in the wild; a first-time mother lioness must be creative in her survival skills to raise a new king, and that includes fooling the old one.

programme.title: In Search of Snow Leopards: Chasing Shadows
programme.desc: We reveal the fascinating life of the snow leopards - the most secretive and least understood of all the great cats - as they are filmed in Spiti Valley in the Indian state of Himachal Pradesh.

programme.title: In Search of Snow Leopards: Chasing Shadows
programme.desc: We reveal the fascinating life of the snow leopards - the most secretive and least understood of all the great cats - as they are filmed in Spiti Valley in the Indian state of Himachal Pradesh.

programme.title: Brotherhood of Lions
programme.sub-title: Hunger drives the cubs to violence and family relationships are complicated; the lions rely on the more agile lionesses for hunting and face challenges such as climate change.
programme.desc: This series tells the compelling and immersive story of the daily life of young lions and their challenges while growing up; it also showcases the struggles and triumphs of the lions.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: A future dispersal of young adult dogs in the Manzi pack looks inevitable, the dry season forces the Kakuli pack to take risks, and ecologist Henry identifies a new dog who has joined the Stork pack.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: Its Julzs last week; an encounter with lions scatters the Stork pack, Julz spots the Kakuli puppies feeding on a puku carcass, and the Manzi pack fight a warthog by the Luangwa River.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.sub-title: Stories abound of a nightmarish invasion of primordial bloodsuckers on the Canadian-US border; Jeremy embarks on a mission to battle the most ancient river monster that hes ever encountered.
programme.desc: Extreme angler Jeremy Wade is on the hunt for freshwater fish with a taste for human flesh. Using forensic methods, Jeremy illustrates to the viewer how these river monsters are constructed to kill.

programme.title: Predator Countdown
programme.sub-title: We journey to the vast continent of North America to witness the enduring struggle between wolves and musk oxen and how bottlenose dolphins hunt for fish.
programme.desc: We journey across Africa, Australia, North America and South America to witness the raw power and tenacity of natures most remarkable predators.

programme.title: Brotherhood of Lions
programme.sub-title: Hunger drives the cubs to violence and family relationships are complicated; the lions rely on the more agile lionesses for hunting and face challenges such as climate change.
programme.desc: This series tells the compelling and immersive story of the daily life of young lions and their challenges while growing up; it also showcases the struggles and triumphs of the lions.

programme.title: Pride of India
programme.desc: Gujarat in India is home to the last Asiatic lions in the wild; a first-time mother lioness must be creative in her survival skills to raise a new king, and that includes fooling the old one.

programme.title: In Search of Snow Leopards: Chasing Shadows
programme.desc: We reveal the fascinating life of the snow leopards - the most secretive and least understood of all the great cats - as they are filmed in Spiti Valley in the Indian state of Himachal Pradesh.

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.sub-title: Stories abound of a nightmarish invasion of primordial bloodsuckers on the Canadian-US border; Jeremy embarks on a mission to battle the most ancient river monster that hes ever encountered.
programme.desc: Extreme angler Jeremy Wade is on the hunt for freshwater fish with a taste for human flesh. Using forensic methods, Jeremy illustrates to the viewer how these river monsters are constructed to kill.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Return to South Luangwa to see the new pups born to the mighty Manzi, the tiny-but-fearless Kakumbi packs, and yearling Snowy face a hungry hyena before a lion pride scatters Manzi mum Wekas pups.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Run into a lion-hyena showdown with Julz as he hunts for the elusive Manzi pack and join Henry from the Zambian Carnivore Program on a house call to the Kakumbi den where another pup has gone missing.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: Predator Countdown
programme.sub-title: We journey to the vast continent of North America to witness the enduring struggle between wolves and musk oxen and how bottlenose dolphins hunt for fish.
programme.desc: We journey across Africa, Australia, North America and South America to witness the raw power and tenacity of natures most remarkable predators.

programme.title: Ice Age: A Frozen World
programme.sub-title: Steve Backshall and Michaela Strachan witness the rise of mega beasts like the woolly mammoth and sabretooth cat; we reveal how these mighty creatures survived such savage environmental extremes.
programme.desc: Naturalist and explorer Steve Backshall - and wildlife presenter Michaela Strachan - take us on a gripping journey into the heart of the Ice Age.

programme.title: Lost Beasts: Unearthed
programme.sub-title: The three-horned Triceratops is one of the most famous of all dinosaurs and often depicted locked in combat with a notorious predator: T-Rex. Did these two prehistoric titans really fight each other?
programme.desc: From deadly T. rexes to giant woolly mammoths, new evidence reveals how giant beasts evolved to conquer the planet, how they grew so big, and what triggered their extinction.

programme.title: Lost Beasts: Unearthed
programme.sub-title: The woolly rhino once roamed northern Europe - now new discoveries from inside a cave in southern England reveal what really killed this Ice Age beast.
programme.desc: From deadly T. rexes to giant woolly mammoths, new evidence reveals how giant beasts evolved to conquer the planet, how they grew so big, and what triggered their extinction.

programme.title: Animal Odyssey
programme.sub-title: Today, the grizzly bear is a star in Yellowstone National Park. But the history of the bear is rooted in that of a large family of mammals: the carnivores, which appeared 60 million years ago.
programme.desc: Where, when, and how did the species we know appear? Today, science has unravelled the great journeys of the species, allowing us to tell the amazing story of animal colonisation.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.sub-title: Dr Amandas team lose a pangolin abused by wildlife traffickers, and we check on a trio of hedgehogs and tag along as the centres baboons and nyala antelopes get a change of scenery.
programme.desc: The team at the Lilongwe Wildlife Trust in Malawi in Africa are dedicated to rescuing and rehabilitating injured and orphaned animals, ensuring they get back into the wild where they belong.

programme.title: Outback Vet
programme.sub-title: Katy takes on the role of avian midwife to a budgie in the Karratha Vet Clinic, Dr Lu rescues a koala on Kangaroo Island, and Ed and Dunc head off on a nighttime crabbing expedition in Shark Bay.
programme.desc: Meet Rick Fenny, a 40-year career veterinarian; he regularly embarks on a round trip across Western Australia to visit remote clients, working with animals in some of the most hostile conditions.

programme.title: Wild LatAm
programme.sub-title: The interior of Brazil is a very varied territory where ecosystems as different as dry forest and flood plains mix; here we find the strange maned wolf, the shy giant anteater, and capuchin monkeys.
programme.desc: A vibrant portrait of the biodiverse habitats in South America; inhabitants range from large to small, from colourful to perfectly camouflaged, and from the lone hunter to thousand-strong hordes.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: This episode marks International Dog Day; Julian has performed lots of surgery on his clients four-legged friends, but its a bit different when the patient is his own faithful companion Emmy.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Bull Pip needs an urgent foot trim, but hes reluctant to lie down and allow Peter do his job; in Boroughbridge, Julian and Katy are operating on Berties the beagles leg.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.sub-title: Cyclone Damien, the biggest cyclone to hit Karratha for ten years, heads towards the Vet Hospital; meanwhile, a lady prepares to cross Australia by camel in the Pilbara desert.
programme.desc: Meet Rick Fenny, a 40-year career veterinarian; he regularly embarks on a round trip across Western Australia to visit remote clients, working with animals in some of the most hostile conditions.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Join Julz and park scout Simon Chulu as they track the Kakuli pack and a Manzi faction thats ditched a tracking collar and broken away from the group.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Julz and Henry from the ZCP track the Kakumbi pups as they face off with a warthog, and Thandie Mweetwa - ZCPs lion specialist - counts the prides that are pushing the Manzi out of their territory.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: Predator Countdown

programme.desc: We journey across Africa, Australia, North America and South America to witness the raw power and tenacity of natures most remarkable predators.

programme.title: Shark
programme.sub-title: Fatal shark attacks doubled in 2023; we explore the man-eating predators behind these shocking figures and meet near-death survivors who have come within inches of being eaten.
programme.desc: With the help of local shark hunters and tracking experts, a thrilling three-day expedition embarks on a quest to chase some of the biggest sharks on the planet.

programme.title: Planet Shark
programme.sub-title: Sharks have evolved to take advantage of every feeding opportunity in the ocean; from aerial acrobats to camouflaged ambush killers, how have these apex predators become so successful?
programme.desc: Sharks are one of the oldest and successful hunters ever to have lived; they dominate every corner of our oceans, but what is it about these extraordinary survivors that makes them so successful?

programme.title: Save This Shark
programme.desc: Surf champion and wildlife conservationist Mick Fanning teams up with leading experts to uncover the hidden truths about sharks, threats, and how to save them from extinction.

programme.title: Wild Battleground
programme.sub-title: Cold hearts beat with a raging hot fury in a frozen world of snow, icy waters and extreme wind chill; from snow leopards to polar bears, these fighters battle it out with each other.
programme.desc: We show how animals use their unique attributes to defeat their opponents; they have honed their skills for millennia and have become masters of communication, camouflage, diplomacy and combat.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.sub-title: Dr Amanda tries to collar a roan antelope, the team chases down blue monkey Indigo while unrest ensues among the vervets, and we examine an eagle owl with bumblefoot and say adieu to Sheila the croc.
programme.desc: The team at the Lilongwe Wildlife Trust in Malawi in Africa are dedicated to rescuing and rehabilitating injured and orphaned animals, ensuring they get back into the wild where they belong.

programme.title: Outback Vet
programme.sub-title: Ed and Dunc set out on a shark mission in Shark Bay to restock Ocean Park after having closed for Covid, and Rick weighs a Rottweiler using his local pubs forklift.
programme.desc: Meet Rick Fenny, a 40-year career veterinarian; he regularly embarks on a round trip across Western Australia to visit remote clients, working with animals in some of the most hostile conditions.

programme.title: Wild LatAm
programme.sub-title: The heart of the South American continent is the Amazon jungle, the largest woodland on the planet; witness the planets largest eagle, the monkey-hunting harpy, pink dolphins and the giant otter.
programme.desc: A vibrant portrait of the biodiverse habitats in South America; inhabitants range from large to small, from colourful to perfectly camouflaged, and from the lone hunter to thousand-strong hordes.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Julian is called to an emergency on Tom Stockils farm and Peter removes an ominous looking lump for boxer dog Boot; this brings back bittersweet memories for Peter of his own beloved boxer Alf.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.
